title: The most ridiculous belief
content:
Yesterday I attended a UFO confrence. But not just any confrence; this one was about recovered UFO's; it was a talk about alien physiology, recovered fragments that were passed around the auidience, and diagrams of how the craft were supposed to fly before they crashed. Each speaker was adressed with riotus appplause and total credulity.

A few months back, just before the election I went to a Destiny Church rally, where I head of 'Bishop' Tamaki's valiant attempts to make NZ into the worlds first [yeah right] theocracy. It was filled with nutcases, and the exact same applause.

This has got me thinking; just what do you think is the most ridiculous belief and why? I'm not talking most dangerous or objectionable, but the one that makes you think 'Dear Lord [or Nonexistent Omnipotent Diety] how the hell [or nonexistent place of punishment] can someone possibly believe that?"

To remove some of the impending discussion I have defined each belief by a statement often associated with the extremity of belief I think is appropriate.

Christianity/Islam, etc: We are right, all those who do not believe will burn in hell forever, let us go out and bash gays!

UFOlogists: Aliens visit us regularly, they abduct and experiment on peole and the govt hushes it all up. We have actual demonstratable scientific proof of this.

New Agers: Horoscopes, palm reading, telepathy, magic, homoeopathy and etc all work 100%, we don't need scientific proof, these things can't be measured by science.

Athesisim: There is no God and anyone who believes there is is a total idiot.

Other: Any other belief you think is criminally stupid. Please go into detail.

A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/lind.jpg[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

Well, I think that there is something to what the UFO (Not the extremists) have to say. I've been to Roswell, and at bare minimum I can say with little doubt that there was a cover up.

I prefer to beleive that it was a government expieriment that was using some kind of nuclear technology; however, I can understand someone beleiving that there are aliens out there. (As for as those who say there's no way they don't exist, they are another group of ignorance)

I voted for Christian extremists; mainly because they are the main poeple I've had to deal with for the last 17 years.

title: Re: You're starting to scare me.
content:
I'm gonna get in trouble, but - Jehova's Witnesses. Had two come round the other day, I invited 'em in so they could sit down and rest and shit. Conversation went (in very general terms) like this:

JW: Look at the world, look how terrible it's become!
Sz: Actually, if you look back over history, we've got it pretty damn good.
JW: The world is in bad shape...and it's going to end soon.
Sz: Cool.
JW: How is that good? *the world will end*!
Sz: Yes, but...don't you teach we go to heaven where it's fantastic, and God is all-loving so we'll all be better off, yes? There's no pain or suffering in heaven, so what's the problem?
JW: ...
Sz: Also, how ridiculous is the notion of an omnipotent deity who sat around for an unimaginable amount of time doing bugger all, before suddenly, and for no apparent reason, deciding to create an entire universe, and then populating just one single, insignificant speck of it, with a couple of million species, and granting only one species an immortal soul? (I read this somewhere, I keep it handy)
JW: *eats my cookies and leaves*

To his credit, he did leave me some reading material. I suspect they'll ignore my logic. I guess a lot of people have similar beliefs, but allowing yourself to get burdened down by 'end of the world' is plain silly. La vita bella.------------------

title: Re: You're starting to scare me.
content:
I answered the door to a couple of Jehovah's Witnesses a few months back, the conversation went something like this:

<Knock knock>

Hello?

Hey, I know you...

Huh?

I know you from somewhere!

Yeah, you do look kinda familiar, now that you mention it...

School! We were in the same high school year, remember?!

Oh yeah, I remember you! So what are you up to now? Oh, right.

<cue long discussion about where everyone is from high school and what they're doing now>

Oh by the way, the world's about to end, here's a magazine.

Thanks.

title: bah
content:
Nobody believes me when I tell them this, and it feels extraordinarily stupid and foolish to type... but I have a completely irrational fear of 'Void' in 3d games. Paralysing, gripping, nervous-twitching fear.

You know in first person shooter games when you can run up to the wall, and the texture gets all pixelated? That sends shivers up my spine. Know how you'll be targetting something down a hallway and you strafe against the wall, so that entire plane gets kinda close to the camera? I tense up.

You know how occasionally an object will be move-through-able, either by accident or cheat? I have real issues with that. It looks solid, I get nervous when I get close to it, and then suddenly part of it is invisible, and I can see through to the blackness/glitchiness/nothingness beyond? I literally freeze up, sweat a little, get all nervous, curse, panic, etc.

If I anticipate it coming, like my racer/character/whatever is careening towards a plane of water, and I know that below it is nothing but inky blackness, I'll turn my head to the side, look away, or just close my eyes until I've respawned.

I get anxious if I have to go underwater, too, because that's a common place for cameras to get all buggy and clip through walls. Like if my player is below water, but the camera is sitting above the water, staring at a pixelated, undulating set of polygons about 3 virtual inches in front of the camera, I tend to set the controller down and leave the room. I can't handle it!

Let's not even discuss what happens when enemies rush towards the screen--melee attackers in first person shooters--or just towards my characters--sharks and biting monsters in platform games... I yell every time. Even if it's a happy faced monster, or an NPC in a game who's just approaching in a hurry. If they get close to the camera, I freak out.

One of my friends still teases me because I couldn't even beat Serious Sam on "Tourist" mode. (For those who don't know, Tourist mode is the easiest difficulty--your character regenerates 2-3 health per second, and no monster attacks for more than 1 damage at a time... the only way to die would be to get surrounded and beat on for nearly half a minute, without making any efforts to fire your weapons or move.) I got approached in a dark hallway by a melee monster who got all up-close-and-personal with the screen, got up from the desk, and left the room.

I suck. But there's a deep-routed belief in me that whatever lurks in 'the Void' is a very real, dangerous thing. Stupid.<!--EZCODE IMAGE START---<img src="http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/posted-pics/XkyRauhKeenLogo.png"/><!--EZCODE IMAGE END---

title: Re: bah
content:
I hear ya Xky, I have a deep fear of dying in games, so much so I used to get up and go away when I died on Keen. Now I'm better, but 3D games, I will not play at all if there's a good chance I'm gonna get clobbered, especially with blood.

As a Jehovah's witmess I'm learning how to go door to door; its quite fun because since I'm not official, I can do stuff people don't expect. One of my favourates was:

Me: *knocks*
Guy: Sorry, not interested.
Me: A guy not interested in free sex and drugs?
Guy: What?
Me: so you *are* interested?
Guy: Hell no!
Me: Oh. *OH* You're 'that way'
Guy: What the hell are you on about?
Me: Take the magazine or I'll sit here annoying you all day, even if you shut the door.

*door slams*

It was fun, and I didn't get smacked, much to my surprise!

Now then; I was going to visit you Szevvy, you still have cookies?

Szevvy Forever!
And Spleen never!

title: Re: ...
content:
Woah.

That's crazy - I have the exact same problem. Whenever I go underwater in 3d games I always tense up, hold my breath and my hands get sweaty. It's especially bad in levels where the water's continually rising and I have to keep my character above water or it'll drown. I fail to complete games because of that.

I wonder what causes that fear?
